item.title: Carrie add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "Sometimes I wonder if men and women really suit each other. Perhaps they should live next door and just visit now and then." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "I have not lived as a woman. I have lived as a man. I've just done what I damn well wanted to, and I've made enough money to support myself, and ain't afraid of being alone." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you want to sacrifice the admiration of many men for the criticism of one, go ahead, get married." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you always do what interests you, at least one person is pleased." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Carrie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Carrie add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Carrie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Carrie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "Try not to have a good time...this is supposed to be educational." -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Education consists mainly of what we have unlearned." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Carrie add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "A primary object should be the education of our youth in the science of government. In a republic, what species of knowledge can be equally important? And what duty more pressing than communicating it to those who are to be the future guardians of the liberties of the country?" -- George Washington

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Carrie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?" -- Virginia Woolf
